qas.question: Around what time did the first political factions start to emerge?
Who was the dominate political party for the first half of the 18th century?
Who was the leader if the Whigs?
In what year did the jacobite rising fail?
What groups first formed in 1715 when the Whigs were dominant?

plausible_answers.text: a basic, if fluid, set of principles

qas.question: What beliefs did the Tories unite behind during the Glorious Revolution in 1715?
In what year did the Exclusion Crisis end?
How long did the English Civil War last?
Who was the leader of the Hanoverian succession?

context: <b4_0>The first political factions<b4_0/>, cohering around <b5_0>a basic, if fluid, set of principles<b5_0/> emerged from the Exclusion Crisis and Glorious Revolution in <a0_0>late-17th-century England<a0_0/>. The Whigs supported Protestant constitutional monarchy against absolute rule and the Tories, originating in the Royalist (or "Cavalier") faction of the English Civil War, were conservative royalist supporters of a strong monarchy as a counterbalance to the republican tendencies of <a1_0>Whigs<a1_0/>, who were the dominant political faction for most of the first half of the 18th century; they supported the Hanoverian succession of <b6_0>1715<b6_0/> against the Jacobite supporters of the deposed Roman Catholic Stuart dynasty and were able to purge Tory politicians from important government positions after the failed Jacobite rising of <a3_0>1715<a3_0/>. The leader of the Whigs was <a2_0><b8_0>Robert Walpole<b8_0/><a2_0/>, who maintained control of the government in the period <b7_0>1721–1742<b7_0/>; his protégé was Henry Pelham (1743–1754).
